FuncDef:
The pppoe-server same-user forbid command enables the function to deny a user's login request if another user having the same MAC address has gone online from the same physical location when each MAC address maps a unique session.
The undo pppoe-server same-user forbid command restores the default configuration.
By default, if each MAC address maps a unique session, an online user is logged out when a new user having the same MAC address as the online user requests to go online from the same physical location.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If one MAC address maps a unique session, run the pppoe-server same-user forbid command to enable the function to deny a user's login request if another user having the same MAC address has gone online from the same physical location.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The pppoe-server same-user forbid command does not take effect if one MAC address maps multiple sessions.
